title: New America (organization) - Wikipedia
snippet: New America was founded in 1999 by Ted Halstead, Sherle Schwenninger, Michael Lind, and Walter Russell Mead as the New America Foundation. The organization is headquartered in Washington, D.C., and also has offices in Oakland, California and Chicago, Illinois.

title: New America Foundation / New America | Library of Congress
snippet: The organization is based in Washington, D.C., with additional offices in New York City. Ted Halstead served as New Americaâ€™s founding President and CEO from 1999 to 2007. Steve Coll served as New Americaâ€™s second President.

title: New America | Devex
snippet: Learn more about New America's jobs, projects, latest news, contact information and geographical presence. New America is a nonprofit, nonpartisan public policy think tank headquartered in Washington, D.C.

title: Our Story
snippet: We are dedicated to realizing the promise of America in an era of rapid technological and social change. At New America, our research and policy recommendations focus on five key thematic areas: education and work; family economic security and wellbeing; global politics for people and planet; political reform and civic engagement; and technology and democracy.
